variants.Description in input context: L166P mutation in DJ-1 (PARK7) associated with Parkinson's disease

Material used.Description: The experiment used HEK293 cells overexpressing wild-type or L166P mutant DJ-1.

Readout description.Result Description: L166P mutant DJ-1 showed 40% reduced enzymatic activity under oxidative stress compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three biological replicates were performed across independent transfections.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate on the same gel.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type DJ-1 overexpression was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used to compare wild-type vs. L166P mutant groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Enzymatic activity â‰¥ 80% of wild-type control
